sentences.sContent: Ultimately, the decision rests with the child’s parents.
sentences.sCn: 最终，决定权在这孩子的父母手中。

sentences.sContent: a long but ultimately successful campaign
sentences.sCn: 一场历时很久但最终成功的运动

sentences.sContent: ...I am currently questioning what kind are the most taxing and ultimately beneficial...
...Certain professors believe in-class exams are ultimately more helpful to students...
...He believes students ultimately learn more and encourages them to form study groups...
...but ultimately failed to adapt to the digital revolution...
...Such values are more likely to motivate workers than financial targets which ultimately only concern a few people...

words.tran: 最后通牒；最后结论；基本原理

trans.tranOther: finally, after everything else has been done or considered
